intro: Lopezia laciniata subsp. gentryi, commonly known as the Gentry's narrowleaf lantera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. This subspecies is noted for its unique morphology and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
